content.question: A skydiver is falling through the air attached to a parachute. The mass of the skydiver-parachute system is <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math>. The upward force of air resistance exerted on the system is given by the equation <math alttext="F sub air equals A times v squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>air </mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><msup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math> is a constant that depends on the shape of the parachute and <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> is the speed of the system. After falling a short time, the system reaches a constant speed <math alttext="v sub T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>T</mi></msub></math>. Which of the following is a correct expression for <math alttext="v sub T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>T</mi></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction g over A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><mfrac><mi>g</mi><mi>A</mi></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of the fraction m g over A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow><mi>A</mi></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the square root of the fraction A g over m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mi>A</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow><mi>m</mi></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the square root of the fraction m g over A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msqrt><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow><mi>A</mi></mfrac></msqrt></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
